descriptions.Continuant: An entity that persists, endures, or continues to exist through time while maintaining its identity.
descriptions.Occurrent: An entity that happens, unfolds, or develops in time. It has temporal parts.
descriptions.Material Entity: A continuant that has some matter as a part.
descriptions.Immaterial Entity: A continuant that has no matter as a part.
descriptions.Object: A material entity that is spatially extended and maximally self-connected (e.g., a cell, a planet).
descriptions.Object Aggregate: A material entity that is a mereological sum of separate objects (e.g., a fleet of ships).
descriptions.Fiat Object Part: A material entity that is part of an object but is not an object itself (e.g., the north half of a planet).
descriptions.Site: An immaterial entity in which other entities can be located (e.g., a room, a hole).
descriptions.Role: A realizable entity that exists because the bearer is in some special physical, social, or institutional set of circumstances.
descriptions.Disposition: A realizable entity that is an intrinsic potential to undergo a specific process.
descriptions.Function: A disposition that exists because of how the entity came into being (e.g., by design or evolution).
descriptions.Process: An occurrent that has temporal parts and depends on a participant.
descriptions.Process Boundary: The instantaneous beginning or end of a process.

Function: The function of a heart to pump blood
The function of a hammer to drive nails

descriptions.Endurant: An entity that is wholly present at any time it exists (e.g., an apple, a person).
descriptions.Perdurant: An entity that extends in time and has temporal parts (e.g., a run, a meeting).
descriptions.Physical Object: An endurant that has spatial location and is not an amount of matter (e.g., a table).
descriptions.Amount of Matter: An endurant that is a mereological sum of matter (e.g., the gold in a ring).
descriptions.Social Object: A non-physical endurant that depends on a community of agents (e.g., a law, a currency).
descriptions.Process: A perdurant that is homeomerous (every part of the process is of the same type, e.g., running).
descriptions.Accomplishment: A perdurant that is not homeomerous and has a natural endpoint (e.g., walking a mile).
descriptions.Achievement: A perdurant that is instantaneous (e.g., reaching the summit).

descriptions.Substantial: An individual that exists in space and time (comparable to Endurant).
descriptions.Event: An individual that happens in time (comparable to Perdurant).
descriptions.Moment: An individual that depends on another individual (e.g., a headache depends on a person).
descriptions.Kind: A rigid sortal that provides a principle of identity (e.g., Person, Dog).
descriptions.Role: A non-rigid sortal that an entity plays in a context (e.g., Student).
descriptions.Phase: A non-rigid sortal that represents a stage in a life cycle (e.g., Child, Adult).
descriptions.Relator: A moment that connects two or more individuals (e.g., a marriage, a contract).
